citations.narrative:
The licensee is lacking a written contingency plan. Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster. Not having a written plan could cause delay of help for the animals and could negatively affect
their health and well-being in the case of an emergency or disaster. Correct by ensuring that a written contingency plan is
implemented, and includes all of the information and documentation as detailed in Section 2.134(a-c) of the Animal
Welfare Act and Animal Welfare Regulations.
***Correct by May 5th, 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The licensee is missing a complete species-appropriate environmental enhancement plan that is required for regulated
birds. The plan, at a minimum, must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint
devices, and exemptions. A species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement is necessary to promote the
psychological well-being of the birds on the premises. Correct by developing a written plan that meets all requirements
and is approved by the attending veterinarian.
***Correct by: May 5th, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility manager.
n

narrative:
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee is lacking a written contingency plan. Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to 
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an 
emergency or disaster. Not having a written plan could cause delay of help for the animals and could negatively affect 
their health and well-being in the case of an emergency or disaster. Correct by ensuring that a written contingency plan is 
implemented, and includes all of the information and documentation as detailed in Section 2.134(a-c) of the Animal 
Welfare Act and Animal Welfare Regulations. 
 
***Correct by May 5th, 2025. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The licensee is missing a complete species-appropriate environmental enhancement plan that is required for regulated 
birds. The plan, at a minimum, must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint 
devices, and exemptions. A species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement is necessary to promote the 
psychological well-being of the birds on the premises. Correct by developing a written plan that meets all requirements 
and is approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
***Correct by: May 5th, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility manager.
